Description: Statue of Huy holding a baboon: the lower half of a grey steatite kneeling figure carrying a figure of a baboon, possibly Thoth, on a pedestal. The upper body of the main figure and the baboon's headdress are lost.
Curator's comments: Statues of this type were probably placed in temples, perhaps with royal permission.
Bibliographic references: Parkinson 1999 / Cracking Codes: The Rosetta Stone and Decipherment (50)
Condition: incomplete - upper part of the main figure lost
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
